diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: Patient presented with 3 days of right lower quadrant pain that localized after initial diffuse abdominal pain. CT imaging revealed an enlarged appendix with thickened walls and surrounding fat stranding, consistent with appendicitis. Additionally, there was a hypodense fluid collection adjacent to the appendix, indicating perforation. No signs of other gastrointestinal issues such as obstruction or mesenteric lymphadenopathy were present.
